metadata.title: CVE-2015-6248 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The ptvcursor_add function in the ptvcursor implementation in epan/proto.cin Wireshark 1.12.x before 1.12.7 does not check whether the expectedamount of data is available, which allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (application crash) via a crafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6248` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1').
